results.title: Beautiful dreamers
results.creator_credit: John Kent Harrison, Martin Walters, Michael Maclear, National Film Board of Canada and Starway Films
results.brief_description: Based on historical events, this film is set in London, Canada in 1880 where Dr Maurice Bucke (Colin Feore) is the new Superintendant at the London Asylum for the Insane. Dr Bucke, a sensitive and humane man, is confronted on a daily basis with the barbaric treatment which his medical staff use to restrain the patients at the Institution - confinement, lobotomies, shock treatment and hysterectomies. At a conference in Philadelphia Bucke meets up with one of America’s greatest writers and poets, Walt Whitman (Rip Torn), who is renowned for his avant-garde ideas about love and sexuality and understanding of the mental condition. At Bucke’s invitation, Walt Whitman visits the London Asylum and before long, the two men embark on a journey of reform - a journey that will radically change Bucke’s life forever, with his wife and with his patients. This is a story of a truly remarkable partnership - of passion, kindness and understanding overcoming prejudice, malpractice and misunderstanding of those who suffer from the unfortunate consequences of mental illness. “By 1882 Dr Bucke had removed all forms of restraint used in the London Asylum. A year later he published ‘Walt Whitman, the man’.” Cast also includes Wendel Meldrum, Sheila McCarthy and Colin Fox.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Kent Harrison, Martin Walters, Michael Maclear, National Film Board of Canada and Starway Films

results.title: Beautiful Ballarat [Edited Version]
results.brief_description:
This film captures the beauty found in the city of Ballarat through the seasons. Highlights include the Begonia Festival, the Avenue of Honour monument and other local historic landmarks.

The footage was filmed by John ‘Jack’ Anderson, and presented in this edited version with music added for an event held at the Regent Theatre in Ballarat on 5th March 2020, “Large as Life: celebrating the life John ‘Jack’ Anderson”.

results.title: Beau Geste
results.creator_credit: Douglas Camfield, Barry Letts and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: From the novel by P.C. Wren, “Beau Geste” is the adventures of three aristocratic British brothers who turn their backs on their privileged lives and join the French Foreign Legion. Drawn together by the ties of blood and loyalty, their courage and honour are tested in the harsh desert world. This is another excellent BBC adaptation and stars Benedict Taylor as Beau Geste, Anthony Calf as Digby and Johnathon Morris as John.

results.title: Beaches (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Garry Marshall, Margaret Jennings South, Bette Midler, Bonnie Bruckheimer, South, Bruckheimer, Silver Screen Partners IV and Touchstone Pictures
results.brief_description: The chance meeting of two young girls from totally different backgrounds becomes the friendship of a lifetime. As they lead their separate lives, they come to realise and later rely on the strength that their friendship provides. Cast includes Bette Midler, Barbara Hershey and John Heard.

results.title: Beat Street
results.creator_credit: Stan Lathan, Harry Belafonte, David V. Picker and Orion Pictures Corporation
results.brief_description: Ramon is a Puerto Rican graffiti artist who hangs with numerous rap and hip-hop artists whilst marking time in the Bronx. His friends, a mix of rappers, dancers and turntablists, yearn to stage a huge hip-hop concert and give voice to their artistic expression. On the cusp of adulthood, the teenagers face all manner of trials, including fledging romances and the stigma of their class, as they face the future. Despite its dated aesthetic, “Beat Street” is a lot of fun, and quite exuberant as it travels from one snappy musical moment to the next. This film is also an interesting view of the Bronx as it existed in the 1980s - a fascinating melting pot of backgrounds, set against the grimy subways, graffiti work, and an underground music and dance scene. Cast includes: Rae Dawn Chong, Guy Davis, John Chardiet, Leon Grant and Robert Taylor. Kool Herc, Kool Moe Dee, The Rock Steady and NY Breakers, Us Girls, Busy Bee, Melle Mel and the Furious Five, Bambaataa & Soul Sonic Force, Tina B., Brenda Starr, Treacherous Three and Doug E. Fresh are among the artists that make an appearance.

results.title: Bears and man
results.creator_credit: Bill Schmalz, Wild Cine Productions and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Two-thirds of all injuries inflicted by bears are inflicted by those who have become panhandling garbage junkies. This film describes the Parks Canada bear-management program in Canada’s mountain national parks. It is designed to protect the visiting public from confrontation with and injury by the bears. Awards: New York; Missoula; Columbus.

results.title: Be clean and healthy
results.creator_credit: Langton Gould-Marks and Australian Instructional Films
results.brief_description: Contrasts healthy children at play with a boy who is “out of everything” because of ill health. Shows simple rules for the care of the body, including the hair and teeth, how to dress comfortably, what to eat, and how to care for eating utensils.

results.title: Bean
results.creator_credit: Mel Smith, Tim Evans, Eric Fellner, Peter Bennett-Jones, NV Polygrams S A and PolyGram Filmproduktion
results.brief_description: In an attempt to get rid of their most inept and detested employee, Mr Bean, The Royal National Gallery of London send him to America to oversee the unveiling of America’s most treasured painting, ‘Whistler’s mother’. The staff of the Grierson Gallery in Los Angeles are not privy to the gallery’s rationale for sending Mr Bean, and still believe that they are dealing with a man of the finest intellect, the scholarly Dr Bean. While in America Mr Bean is billetted to stay with David Langley (Peter MacNicol), much to the annoyance of his family who seriously doubt his supposedly brilliant credentials. As Mr Bean unleashes his particular brand of behaviour, which inevitably ends in disaster, they too begin to wonder about the enigmatic Mr Bean. The most significant of his disasters includes destroying ‘Whistlers’ mother’, forcing him into panic mode to rectify the situation before he gives a speech at the grand unveiling. Cast also includes Mel Smith, Pamela Reed and Harris Yulin. Includes 20 minutes of unseen footage as well as interviews with Rowan Atkinson and Mel Smith.
